Title: Right-adjoint functors are left-exact?
AcceptedAnswer: As other have stated, there are lots of good properties for adjoint functors. I will just prove your $F(0)=0$ statement. Let $G$ be left adjoint par to $F$. Then for all $S$-modules $X$ and $R$-modules $Y$ we have bijection $Hom_R(GX,Y) \simeq Hom_S(X,FY)$. Put $Y=0$ and $X=F0$. So we get: $$Hom_S(F0,F0) \simeq  Hom_R(GF0,0) \simeq \{0\}.$$ Now, if $F0\neq 0$, then there would be at least two different S-module-homomorphisms $F0 \to F0$ (namely, identity and zero-homomorphism), which would be a contradiction.
